intro: Chamaecallis, commonly known as the everlasting daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers and are native to various regions in the Americas. Chamaecallis species typically have a rosette of basal leaves and produce numerous small, inconspicuous flowers in a central disc. They are often found in dry, rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The genus includes around 100 species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
